title: Senior Mechanical Engineer
job_desc:
Job description

  • Conceptualize design and develop mechanical systems and components for robotics project.

  • Create detailed 3D models and engineering drawings using CAD software.

  • Prepare and review technical specifications and machine documentation.

  • Oversee the assembly process and ensure machine quality,

  • perform simulation and experimental tests to evaluate the machine performance.

  • Optimize mechanical systems and components for improved performance and cost- effectiveness.

  • Stay Current with the latest mechanical engineering technologies and engineering.

  • Implementation of design verification and validation process.

Education

  • Bachelor's Degree in Mechanical Engineering, Mechatronics Engineering or related fields.

Experience

  • With 3-5 years professional experience as Mechanical engineer or similar role.

  • Expert in CAD software

  • Knowledge in engineering, mathematics, thermodynamics and materials science.

  • Experience in implementing DFMEA

  • Extensive experience working on engineering projects

  • Strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail

  • Excellent verbal and written communications skills

title: Associate Mechanical Facilities Engineer (Licensed ME) - Cebu
job_desc:
Job Description:

  • Maintains, monitors and troubleshoots UPS, Genset, FAS, HVAC System, Fire Suppression, Access Controls and Security systems, Facilities Monitoring System.

  • Conducts installation of racks, cages, cable trays and rack accessories.

  • Conducts installation, calibration troubleshooting, repair and maintenance of various electrical, mechanical, electronic, voice and data cabling systems. 

  • Responds to system maintenance emergencies whenever needed.

  • Implement Preventive Maintenance Plan on a regular basis.

  • Regularly conducts various testing devices to gauge system/equipment efficiency and diagnose malfunction.  

  • Responsible for ensuring that everything in the server’s area is in place, clean and  in its proper order.

  • Provides support in the installation and operational work of Systems and Network Support Group.

  • Assists Sales group in conducting physical tour in the VITRO data center facilities for prospective and existing clients. 

  • Assist in providing media vaulting service to the client.

  • Provides support in ensuring attainment of FSG Functional Objectives and Quality Objectives reflected in VDC ISO 9001 documentation. 

  • Assist in supervision of contractors conducting work activities (e.g. repairs, installations, modifications, etc) in the VITRO data center premises.

Job Requirements:

  • Graduate of Mechanical Engineering.

  • Must be a Licensed Mechanical Engineer.

  • Open to work on call and 24/7 shift schedule.

  • Fresh Graduates are welcome to apply.

  • Can start ASAP.

  • Willing to be assigned in Mandaue Cebu City.

title: Mechanical Engineer | Permanent WFH | Day Shift | Weekends Off
job_desc:
Power Global Equipment with Smarter, Tougher, Purpose-Built Designs

Get your hands on designs that go the distance. Be part of a high-performing team turning raw specs into rugged, fit-for-purpose machinery attachments that endure the harshest worksites. Collaborate with top engineers overseas, push SolidWorks to its limits, and drive innovation that hits the ground working—all while staying local. Your next build? A global reputation.

Job Description

As a Mechanical Engineer, you’ll collaborate with the design and projects team to validate and optimize earthmoving and material handling attachments using FEA and calculations. You’ll lead projects from R&D to manufacturing, balancing performance and cost, while mentoring junior engineers and fostering a culture of technical excellence and teamwork.

Job Overview

Employment type: Full-Time

Shift: Day Shift (Monday–Friday, 7:00 AM – 4:00 PM), Weekends Off

Work setup: Permanent Work From Home

Exciting Perks Await!

  • Competitive Salary Package

  • Permanent WFH arrangement

  • Day shift schedule

  • Fixed weekends off

  • Fully customized Emapta laptop with peripherals 

  • HMO coverage with free dependent upon regularization

  • Unlimited upskilling through Emapta Academy courses (Want to know more? Visit https://bit.ly/EmaptaTrainingCalendar)

  • Free 24/7 access to our office gyms (Ortigas and Makati) with a free physical fitness trainer!

  • Exclusive Emapta Lifestyle perks (hotel and restaurant discounts, and more!)

  • Unlimited opportunities for employee referral incentives across the organization

  • Standard government and Emapta benefits

  • Total of 20 annual leaves to be used on your own discretion (including 5 credits convertible to cash)

  • Fun engagement activities for employees

  • Mentorship and exposure to global leaders and teams

  • Career growth opportunities

  • Diverse and supportive work environment

The Qualifications We Seek

Education and Credentials

  • Tertiary qualification in Mechanical Engineering (DipEng or BEng preferred)

Technical Skills and Experience

  • Minimum of 3 years' experience in mechanical engineering

  • In-depth knowledge of earthmoving machinery and attachments

  • Proven experience in process and continuous improvement

  • Background in people management and team leadership

  • Strong understanding of OH&S regulations and compliance

  • Strategic planning and quality management expertise

  • High attention to detail and a solutions-oriented mindset

  • Positive, proactive, and can-do attitude

Leadership Competencies

  • Ability to lead and motivate teams toward achieving goals

  • Skilled at navigating ambiguity in dynamic environments

  • Strong commercial awareness and decision-making capability

  • Results-driven with a focus on high performance

Your Daily Tasks

Production

  • Design products from initial concept to workshop drawings, with input from the engineering team and other departments

  • Re-engineer past designs to optimize product performance

  • Prepare workshop drawings for modified existing designs

  • Run Finite Element Analysis (FEA) on new and existing designs

  • Design and implement cost-effective equipment modifications to improve safety and reliability

  • Develop, test, and evaluate theoretical designs

  • Discuss and resolve complex issues with manufacturing departments, sub-contractors, suppliers, and customers

  • Ensure products can be manufactured reliably and perform consistently in operating environments

  • Manage projects using sound engineering principles and techniques

  • Produce detailed specifications and outline designs

  • Recommend design modifications based on prototype testing results

  • Apply research, analytical, conceptual, and planning skills to problem-solving

  • Consider cost, safety, and time implications in all design work

People Management

  • Provide leadership and direction to assigned team members

  • Support the development of a harmonious work environment through team building and training of apprentices and employees

  • Assist in resolving technical queries

  • Manage relationships with clients and stakeholders

  • Exercise discretion and independent judgment in making commercial and operational decisions

Teamwork

  • Communicate relevant information effectively and efficiently with colleagues, team members, and supervisors

  • Actively participate in continuous improvement initiatives

  • Share knowledge, experience, and best practices with colleagues

Occupational Health & Safety (OH&S)

  • Apply OH&S principles consistently in the workplace

  • Maintain clean and safe workstations in line with housekeeping standards

Policy and Process

  • Adhere to all company policies and procedures at all times

  • Perform other tasks as requested by management when required

  • Maintain punctuality and flexibility in work hours to meet project deadlines

  • Uphold company standards in personal presentation, language, conduct, and attitude when interacting with clients and suppliers

Tools and Systems Used

  • Operate daily: SolidWorks 2022 or similar CAD software, FEA tools, Microsoft Office Suite, Excel, and Fabnet ERP System

About the Client: Engineering Innovation, Built to Perform

Kerfab is where heavy-duty meets high performance. For over 30 years, they’ve engineered tough, purpose-built attachments for agriculture, mining, waste, and civil industries—turning complex challenges into custom-built solutions. With a growing production footprint, robotic automation, and their standout WastePro range, Kerfab isn’t just moving materials—they’re moving the industry forward. When others bolt, Kerfab builds.

Welcome to Emapta Philippines!

Join a team that values camaraderie, excellence, and growth. Recognized as one of the Top 20 Dream Companies of Filipinos in 2024, Emapta stands proudly alongside industry giants, offering stability and exciting career opportunities. Your career flourishes here with competitive compensation, international clients, and a work culture focused on collaboration and innovation. Work with global clients across industries, supported by a stable foundation and like-minded professionals passionate about making an impact. Apply now and be part of the #EmaptaEra!

title: junior engineer
job_desc:
Automation System Design and Development:

Key Responsibilities:

Software and Hardware Integration:

Continuous Improvement:

title: Mechanical Engineer – Analysis and Simulation
job_desc:
RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Scope of works shall cover the creation of Finite Element Modeling and Analysis, up to 2D detailing of Port Crane/Berth Crane structures. Scope of work shall cover the creation of Crane Simulator. Responsibility includes equipment dynamics visualization and validation and programming. The chosen candidate can look forward to professional growth and career development.

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Graduate of BS in Mechanical Eng’g; Licensed PRC Mechanical Engineer; Fresh graduates are welcome to apply.

  • Preferably with background in Mechatronics.

  • Experienced in Femap, Nastran and other FEA software is an advantage.

  • Interest in learning and working with dynamic simulation or similar tasks.

  • With background in mechanical dynamics and its numerical analysis

  • Proficient in Python and other coding language is an advantage.

  • Must be hardworking and with excellent problem solving skills.

  • Knowledge in Japanese language is an advantage but not required.

title: Junior Piping Engineer - TJAS
job_desc:
RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • The scope of work shall cover design and calculation of Incineration, and Wastewater Treatment Facilities. The chosen candidate will be involved in modelling equipment, structure, piping and supports, layout and detail drawing preparations using various 2D and 3D CAD softwares.

REQUIREMENTS:

  • Graduate of BS in Mechanical Eng’g; PRC Licensed Mechanical Engineer; Fresh graduates are welcome to apply.

  • With relevant experience in planning, design, and calculation of piping system, including modelling of equipment, piping supports and piping layout of Incineration, and Wastewater Treatment Facilities are preferred.

  • Preferably has background in using Autocad, EYECAD, E3D, Plant 3D, Inventor, Navisworks Manage or any related 3D software.

  • Familiar with design standard JIS.

  • Knowledgeable, and have good skills in using Microsoft Office.

  • Must be willing to work within a team of engineers to execute given task.

  • Must be willing to learn the Japanese language to have a better communication
    with Japanese counterparts.

title: Process Sr. Engineer
job_desc:
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Performs troubleshooting/investigation of process and jigs related problems.

  • Implements corrective actions and initiates production/process improvement projects.

  • Performs necessary activities related to new model production preparation and new change of color development:

  • Participates on 1QDC Activity to ensure new model and COC preparation targets are attained.

  • Designs and procures racks, buckets, jigs, machines, special tools and other items needed.

  • Conducts Failure Mode and Effect Analyss / Evaluations.

  • Prepares process flow layout, process planning sheet & quality documents for welding.

  • Prepares material flow and evaluation to all new model for welding.

  • Conducts Time and Motion Study and Line Balancing Activities.

  • Performs activities related to Welding Line Preparation.

  • Uses of known quality tools like SPC, 7QC, 8D, FMEA and other tools to prevent/solve the issue.

  • Implements POKA YOKE solution on all jig, fixtures and equipment.

  • Conducts performance evaluation of subordinates.

  • Prepares packaging designs of localized parts including prototyping and evaluation.

  • Performs other related duties or projects that may be assigned.

JOB QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Graduate of any Engineering Course preferably Electrical, Mechanical, Industrial Engineering.

  • Preferably Male (as part of Job Requirement).

  • With at least 1-2 year experience in similar capacity.

title: MEPF MECHANICAL ENGINEER
job_desc:
Primary Responsibilities:

  1. Project Coordination:
  • Collaborate with architects, engineers, contractors, and subcontractors to integrate MEPF systems into the overall construction plan.
  • Ensure proper alignment of mechanical, electrical, plumbing, and firefighting systems with project specifications and designs.
  • Schedule and coordinate MEPF activities to avoid clashes and ensure efficient project progress.

2. Design Review and Conflict Resolution:

  • Review MEPF designs and shop drawings to identify potential conflicts or errors.
  • Propose solutions to resolve design issues, ensuring compliance with codes and project requirements.
  • Utilize BIM (Building Information Modeling) tools for clash detection and coordination.

3. Site Supervision and Quality Assurance:

  • Monitor MEPF installation on-site to ensure adherence to plans, standards, and safety regulations.
  • Conduct inspections and quality checks to maintain high standards of workmanship.
  • Ensure timely completion of MEPF works within project timelines.

4. Documentation and Compliance:

  • Maintain comprehensive documentation, including RFI (Request for Information) responses, as-built drawings, and inspection reports.
  • Ensure all MEPF systems comply with local building codes, environmental regulations, and industry standards.

5. Stakeholder Communication:

  • Act as the primary point of contact for MEPF-related queries and concerns.
  • Conduct meetings with stakeholders to provide updates, address challenges, and align objectives.

6. Cost and Resource Management:

  • Monitor budgets and optimize resource allocation for MEPF systems.
  • Coordinate procurement and delivery schedules for MEPF materials and equipment.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering. 
  • At least 3 years of experience in MEPF coordination or related roles in the construction industry.
  • Prior experience with large-scale construction projects, particularly in high-rise buildings, commercial spaces, or industrial facilities, is preferred.
  • Strong understanding of MEPF systems, construction processes, and building codes.
  • Proficiency in design and project management software such as AutoCAD, Revit, Navisworks, and MS Project.
  • Knowledge of BIM processes for coordination and clash detection.
  • Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
  • Effective communication and interpersonal skills for collaboration with multidisciplinary teams.
  • Strong organizational and time management skills to handle multiple priorities.
  • Attention to detail and the ability to foresee potential construction issues.
  • Technical knowledge of modern building systems and technologies.
  • Leadership and the ability to guide teams and subcontractors.
  • Commitment to quality, safety, and efficiency in construction practices.

title: Sales Engineer - Specialty Lubricants and Greases
job_desc:

Apply now and get a chance to work in a dynamic and friendly working environment surrounded by great teams and peers, where there is work life balance.

title: Site Reliability Engineer - Intern
job_desc:
OpsWerks Academy Program:

Our intensive technical and mindset training is designed to fuel your development, equipping you with the skills and experience needed to thrive in the industry. We go beyond just honing technical skills; we recognize the importance of a well-rounded professional for a holistic development. You’ll enhance not only your technical prowess but also your invaluable people skills, paramount for navigating the dynamic landscape of your future career. Our internship experience is one-of-a-kind, tailored to unlock your full potential by engaging you in vibrant community chats, enlightening office-hours discussions, and personalized guidance during one-on-one check-ins with your mentors.

Stages of Internship:

A.  3-Month Academy Internship

  • 5 Weeks Foundational Courses (First Term)

  • Midpoint Assessment

  • 6 Weeks Advance Courses (Second Term) Onsite Cebu Office.
    - Pass Certified Kubernetes Administrator (CKA) Certification Mock Exam
    - Case Study and Presentation
    - Final Assessment and Graduation

B.  3-Month Pre-production (Cebu)

  • Real-world application of the technical learnings from the Internship.

  • Receive Platform, System, or Product trainings.

  • Continuous tech stack upskilling.

  • Light to medium interaction with partners.

  • Goal Setting

C.  Final Assessment and Transition to Full-time Consultant

Benefits:

  • Hybrid 3-Month online and in-person technical training and hands-on exercises. Throughout the internship, you will receive a specially curated site reliability engineering (SRE) tool stack and hands-on exposure to the newest technologies used by hypergrowth technology companies.

  • Learn and get paid: We value your dedication and commitment to learning. As an intern, you will receive a competitive industry allowance that recognizes your contribution and supports your financial needs during the program. This allowance ensures that you can focus on your growth and development without any financial concerns.

  • Service laptop: Once you successfully complete the first term of the internship, you will be granted free use of a MacBook service unit.

  • Be a Full-time OpsWerks Consultant: Your hard work and dedication can open doors to exciting career opportunities. Exceptional interns who demonstrate outstanding skills, adaptability, and a strong work ethic may be offered a full-time position within our esteemed organization upon successfully completing the coursework and requirements of the 9 months program. Seize this chance to secure a promising engineering career path in a high-technology industry.

Your Responsibilities:

As an intern, you need to learn and understand all the subjects included in the Academy Syllabus. There will be a Team Leader who will provide guidance, motivation, and support throughout your journey. Coaches of the Academy Faculty will also be there to help you understand the subjects, set goals, and identify resources to help you succeed.

Therefore, as an intern, you are expected to:

  • Comply with the behavioral and technical guidelines set in The Academy.

  • Complete and present all assigned projects, tasks, and case studies with relevance and exploratory depth.

  • Build healthy relationships among other interns through active involvement in all group activities, troubleshooting, and issue resolution.

About you:

  • Batch 2023-2025 computer engineering graduate, Information Systems, or related engineering discipline from a reputable school in Visayas or Mindanao.

  • Those with a prior experience in a technical field with less than 2 years of working experience will have a head start.

  • Possess a foundational understanding of Linux OS administration, networking concepts, and cloud technologies.

  • Familiarity with programming languages like C++, Python, and Shell scripting.

  • Good communication skill which is essential for effective collaboration

  • Have the ability to maintain composure in high-pressure situations to demonstrate resilience and critical thinking skills.

  • Work best as part of a team.

  • Have a genuine thirst for learning and personal growth.

  • Be agreeable to completing the 3-month learning objectives at night or daytime.

Join OpsWerks Academy, the company’s engineering internship program, and acquire character-building skills in identifying and implementing essential processes, while developing a specialization in cloud computing, platform infrastructure, or data engineering. To thrive in these roles, your analytical and communication skills are paramount and will be developed and strengthened.

If you aspire to embark on a journey toward becoming one of our future leaders, we eagerly await your application. Together, we can make technology “werk” for the people.

title: Mechanical Design Engineer (Solar Panel Design)
job_desc:
We are seeking a skilled Mechanical Design Engineer with 3 to 5 years of experience in designing solar panels to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate should have a strong background in mechanical design, structural analysis, and solar power plant engineering. Experience in the solar power plant sector is highly preferred.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Design and develop mechanical components and support structures for solar panels and solar power plant installations.

  • Conduct structural and thermal analysis of solar panel mounting systems to ensure durability and efficiency.

  • Work on 3D modeling, CAD designs, and simulations for solar panel systems using industry-standard software (AutoCAD, SolidWorks, PVSyst, etc.).

  • Optimize mechanical designs for cost-efficiency, ease of installation, and long-term reliability.

  • Collaborate with electrical engineers, civil engineers, and project managers to integrate mechanical designs into complete solar power solutions.

  • Perform load calculations, wind resistance, and environmental impact assessments for solar installations.

  • Select and specify materials suitable for solar panel mounting structures and support systems.

  • Assist in the evaluation and testing of prototypes to validate designs and improve system performance.

  • Ensure compliance with industry standards, regulations, and best practices related to mechanical design and solar power engineering.

  • Prepare technical documentation, reports, and presentations for internal teams and clients.

Qualifications & Skills:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering or a related field.

  • 3 to 5 years of experience in mechanical design for solar panels or solar power plants.

  • Proficiency in AutoCAD, SolidWorks, PVSyst, ANSYS, or other relevant design and simulation tools.

  • Strong knowledge of solar panel racking, mounting systems, and structural engineering principles.

  • Familiarity with solar energy technologies, PV systems, and industry standards (IEC, ASCE, ASTM, etc.).

  • Experience in finite element analysis (FEA), thermal simulations, and stress testing for solar equipment.

  • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.

  • Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience in designing utility-scale solar power plants.

  • Knowledge of wind load, seismic design considerations, and corrosion resistance for outdoor installations.

  • Familiarity with construction and installation procedures for solar systems.

  • Certification in solar energy or mechanical design (e.g., NABCEP, LEED, or related certifications) is a plus.

title: Project Development Engineer (Mechanical)
company: BTSMC Managing Solutions, Inc (formerly Brunel Technical Services Manpower Corp)
job_desc:
Qualifications: 

  • Graduate of Mechanical Engineering

  • At least 5 -10 years' experience in Construction, Design & Engineering work.

  • 3 years of Oil & Gas experience is a plus.

  • Knowledge of international codes and standards: API & ASME 

  • Familiarity with design software, such as MS Office, AutoCAD, MS Project, AFT Fathom, or other same/relevant design software

  • Flexible with work location.
     

Job Summary:

  • Acts as Project Development Engineer for BTSMC’s Projects responsible for providing Project Development Support Services to Clients CAPEX projects, ensuring the consistent implementation of the Opportunity Delivery Manual (ODM), Client’s & Industry Design Standards and PH Statutory Requirements, and delivering the Client’s targets in CAPEX, meeting the project targets on Performance to Design, Budget, Schedule, and Construction Safety. 

 

Responsibilities:

  • Prepares projects status report by collecting, analyzing, summarizing information and trends, and recommending actions. 

  • Attend and participate in BTSMC’s regular progress meetings and other project meetings. 

  • Attend and participate in the Client’s regular progress meetings and the other project meetings.

  • Prepares Project Services Plan (PSP) to initiate Design and Engineering (D&E) work.

  • Determines project scope by securing customer’s requirements by gathering the necessary information.

  • Prepares the required documents, ensures internal reviews by BTSMC Subject Matter Experts (SME) are done and secures support and approvals from relevant client’s approving staff. 

  • Consolidates the required drawings and designs in coordination with BTSMC Design Center, ensures interval reviews by BTSMC SMEs are done, and secure support/ approval from client’s approving staff.

  • Secure / Request cost estimates from BTSMC Design Center (DC) in coordination with relevant BTSMC department and/or other design consultants.

  • Prepare projects schedule in coordination with relevant BTSMC & client’s staff.

  • Maintains project’s bid documents, conducts the bidding to the Client’s accredited vendors, and conducts Technical Bid evaluations. Assist client’s Contract Procurement (CP) staff in the commercial Bid evaluation as and when required. 

  • Monitor compliance to applicable codes, practices, QA/QC policies, safety policies, performance standards and specifications.

  • Maintain safe and clean working environment by enforcing procedures, rules and regulations. 

  • Collate all required project documents and file them in accordance with the Project Filling Guideline and File plan.

  • Upload the files to the BTSMC SharePoint and share them with the Construction Assurance and Project Services group. 

  • Ensure the integrity of the QMS is maintained.

  • Performs other duties that may be assigned by the Immediate Superior from time to time. 

  • May be asked to support other projects and perform other activities related to the PDE role from time to time such as but not limited to: Jet A1, LNG, Demolition, I&M, OOSI, Bamboo, TSO, etc.
     

Other Details:

  • Work Schedule: Monday to Saturday / 48 hrs per week

  • Work Set-up: Full On-site

  • Work Location: TFC Taguig City, Tabangao, Batangas, BTSMC Head Office (Cubao, Quezon City)

  • Company Given Benefits: HMO Insurance for Principal only (with dental coverage) and AD&D (Accidental Death and Dismemberment) Insurance

  • Government Mandated Benefits: SSS, PHIC, HDMF, 13th month pay, 5 days Service Incentive Leave per year

  • Paid Regular and Special Non-Working Holiday if unworked. 

  • With OT Meal Allowance

  • Reimbursable Pre-Employment Medical Exam (Basic 5, ECG and Drug Test)

title: Research and Product Development Engineer
job_desc:
Job Summary

We are looking for a Research and Product Development Engineer who thrives on innovation and creative problem-solving. You will be responsible for designing and developing products using engineering principles. This role requires knowledge of CAD tools such as AutoCAD, Inventor, or SolidWorks, and a strong interest in product development. You'll collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to ensure the feasibility, functionality, and quality of our products, while driving continuous improvement through research and development.

Key Duties & Responsibilities

  • Design and develop product using CAD software (AutoCAD, Inventor, SolidWorks).

  • Conduct research and development to improve existing products and explore new innovations.

  • Perform data analysis using statistical tools to support design decisions.

  • Design, execute, and analyze experiments for product validation and development.

  • Collaborate with engineering, manufacturing, and quality teams to ensure product feasibility and compliance with industry standards.

  • Create technical documentation and present findings effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences.

  • Manage multiple projects effectively and deliver on deadlines.

  • Continuously seek and implement process and design improvements.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Metallurgical, Mechanical, Mechatronics, Materials, Electrical, Electronics, or Chemical Engineering, Applied Physics, or Material Science.

  • Knowledge in CAD software (AutoCAD, Inventor, SolidWorks).

  • Background in data analysis using statistical tools.

  • Skilled in designing, conducting, and analyzing experiments.

  • Proficient in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint).

  • Excellent project management and technical communication skills.

  • Strong interpersonal and team collaboration abilities.

  • Fresh Graduates with strong academic or project-based performance are highly encouraged to apply!

  • Willing to work in Monday to Friday with an alternating Saturday schedule

  • Willing to work onsite at our Sta. Maria, Bulacan plant.

"Motolite offers you not just a job, but a career with boundless opportunities"

title: Building Engineer (Robinsons Offices) - Dumaguete City
job_desc:
Job Description:

  • Overall in-charge of the engineering operations and maintenance of the building and its equipment – must be familiar with major building equipment and systems such as electrical substation and power plant, air-conditioning and ventilation, vertical transport, water distribution, sewage treatment, fire detection and alarm, fire protection, etc.
  • Creates and secures approval for various engineering scope of works for maintenance and repairs.
  • Creates and implements the 52-week maintenance program.
  • Acts as Pollution Control Officer and Safety Officer.
  • Coordinates with tenants on their various technical requirements and ensure that fit-out plans are reviewed and implemented in accordance to the approved Construction and Fit-out Guidelines.
  • Recommends improvement plans for inclusion in OPEX and CAPEX budget, implements energy conservation measures and ensure that utilities of tenants are timely recorded and processed for charging.
  • Requests and justifies maintenance and repairs works and special projects.
  • Monitors progress of requisitions and coordinates with various support departments to ensure commitments are met within target timelines.
  • Operationally reports to the Building Manager and administratively reports to the Head of Engineering.

 

Qualifications:

  • Candidate must be licensed Electrical or Mechanical Engineer
  • Experience of 3-7 years in engineering operations and maintenance
  • With supervisory capacity for at least 3 years

 

Locations:

  • Dumaguete City

 

===

 

Additional Information

Career Level:

Supervisory role with 3-7 years of experience in engineering operation and maintenance

 

Qualification:

Licensed Electrical or Mechanical Engineer

 

Years of Experience:

3 years

 

Job Type:

Full-Time

 

Job Specializations:

Engineering operations and maintenance, government compliance, planning, project implementation, strategic planning

title: Piping Engineer – TJAS
job_desc:
RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • The scope of work shall cover design and calculation of Incineration, and Wastewater Treatment Facilities. The chosen candidate will be involved in modelling equipment, structure, piping and supports, layout and detail drawing preparations using various 2D and 3D CAD softwares.

REQUIREMENTS:

  • Graduate of BS in Mechanical Eng’g; PRC Licensed Mechanical Engineer.

  • Having relevant experience in planning, design, and calculation of piping system, including modelling of equipment, piping supports and piping layout of Incineration, and Wastewater Treatment Facilities are required.

  • With at least 3 years of relevant experience.

  • With background in using Autocad, EYECAD, E3D, Plant 3D, Inventor, Navisworks Manage or any related 3D software.

  • Familiar with design standard JIS.

  • Knowledgeable, and have good skills in using Microsoft Office.

  • Must be willing to work within a team of engineers to execute given task.

  • Must be willing to learn the Japanese language to have a better communication
    with Japanese counterparts.

title: Sales Engineer/Supervisor
job_desc:
• Licensed Electrical/Mechanical Engineer

  • With at more than 3 years experience as Sales Engineer in power and energy sector

  • Experienced in the preparation of various Project Contracts

  • Able to work well under pressure

  • Customer focused

  • Willing to be assigned to provincial area from time to time and to go out of the country

title: Development Engineer
job_desc:
• Candidate must possess at least Bachelor's Degree in Mechanical and Industrial Engineering
  • With or without working related experience
  • Knowledgeable in analysis process
  • Willing to plan, create and implement improvement 
  • Can monitor effectiveness of improvement activity
  • Will lead the team on all activity including parts evaluation and analysis.

title: Site Engineer / QC Engineer
job_desc:
Qualifications:

- Bachelor of Science in Civil Engineer Graduate
- Preferably with Professional Regulation Commission (PRC) License
- With Construction Occupational Safety & Health Training  

 

  • Job description
  • Plans and reviews overall status of project in coordination with Project Manager, and Construction Manager 
  • Ensures all site resources (labor, machinery, materials, sub-contractors, etc.) are effectively utilized and monitored in order to achieve timely completion of the projects
  • Ensures the Project Manager is promptly provided with any relevant documentation received from either the client or authorities.
  • Identifies and records any possible variations to the contract, ensuring the Project Manager / Construction Manager is promptly notified
  • Ensures site logbook is completed at the completion of each day, accurately recording the day’s accomplishments
  • Implement site inspection to safeguard good quality installations and finished product.
  • Ensure all parts of the works are constructed in accordance with the drawings, specifications and design and that work is being executed to an acceptable standard.
  • Maintain contact with the main contractor at site level at all stages of the contract.
  • Ensure all works are undertaken in accordance with safe working practices and current health and safety legislations, be vigilant to any actual or potential hazards
  • Keeping accurate records of all site activities
  • Overall checking of major structural elements prior to concreting.
  • Monitor the status of work orders prior to the site job execution.
  • Prepares construction schedule, Material delivery schedule, Equipment and Manpower loading for the project.
  • Documents and evaluates all proposed work variations and its cost implications for confirmation of the owner’s representatives prior to its implementation at site.
  • Closely coordinates with the owner’s representatives of the project, catering to their needs and requirements and maintaining a good rapport with the group.
  • Monitor and supervise the project.
  • Prepare accomplishment report
  • Attend site coordination meetings with other subcontractors and main contractor,
  • Coordinate with store/equipment personnel about the mobilization and demobilization of machinery and equipment,
  • Estimate and orders concrete, steel bars and other necessary materials for the project/site,
  • Implement operating budgets for Operation Department
  • Establish and administer cost control system
  • Report directly to the project Manager the accomplishments and difficulties encountered during work on a day-to-day basis
  • Perform other related works as directed by the Project Manager and perform other works related to day-to-day operations of project site as may be necessary

title: Production Engineer (Toner)
job_desc:
• Candidate must possess at least bachelor’s degree in industrial engineering

  • With at least 1-year related work experience as Production Engineer

  • With very good Communication, Leadership, and Presentation Skills

  • Proficient in using MS applications especially MS Excel

  • Must have background in Production Progress Monitoring and Recovery Planning

  • Must have background in Implementation of Improvement Activity

  • Knowledgeable in Basic/New QC tools

title: IT Infrastructure Support Engineer - Mechanical Tools
job_func: Help Desk & IT Support (Information & Communication Technology)
job_desc:
Our Purpose:


TERADYNE, where experience meets innovation and driving excellence in every connection. We are fueled by creativity and diversity of thought and in our workforce. Our employees are supported to innovate and learn something new every day.
We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.

 

 

Opportunity Overview:

 

Are you prepared to embrace the challenge of shaping the future of one of the most unique and dynamic IT infrastructure support teams? Join our innovative tools and technology support group and collaborate with esteemed professionals in both mechanical and thermal engineering. As enablers of future Mechanical engineering technologies, you will excel in our highly dynamic, customer-focused environment, and be part of an interdisciplinary team responsible for maintaining all aspects of engineering development infrastructure.

 

This full-time role involves working closely with mechanical engineers and managers.

 

 

The ideal candidate in this role will be a critical technical support resource responsible for:

- Assisting internal customers with development tools used in both Mechanical and Thermal engineering groups

- Triaging and troubleshooting IT incidents affecting engineering development

- Collaborating with various core IT teams on infrastructure improvement projects

- Performance benchmarking, monitoring key systems and services

- Creating and maintaining technical support documentation

 

You are also:

- Self-motivated continuously striving to grow and to keep up with modern technologies

- An excellent communicator and able to work without direct supervision

- Highly organized and skilled in effective task prioritization and always ahead of others

- An innovative thinker unafraid of failure and passionate about embracing challenges

 

All About You:


We seek individuals who share our passion and determination. Our commitment to customer success drives us to go the extra mile. If you’re ready to join us in this mission, take a closer look at the minimum criteria for the position.

 

- Must be able to work during weekends on rotations and flexible hours

- 3+ years of related experience with a bachelor’s degree related to Mechanical Design with SOLIDWORKS or like.

- Working knowledge of Product Data Management (PDM) (SOLIDWORKS PDM Professional preferred)

- Working knowledge of Computer Aided Engineering (CAE) (SOLIDWORKS Simulation / Flow Simulation preferred)

- Working knowledge of Windows administration.

- Strong customer service skills with previous Help Desk experience

 

Nice to have:

- Experience with Autodesk Inventor and Autodesk Vault

- Experience with CREO and Pro/INTRALINK

- Experience with ANSYS Mechanical

- Proficiency in Product Life Management (PLM) system (e.g. Teamcenter)

- Familiarity with programming (e.g. Visual Basic)

 

We are only considering candidates local to position location and are unable to provide relocation for this position. This position is not eligible for visa sponsorship.

title: Service Supervisor-Ford Ormoc
job_func: Customer Service - Call Centre (Call Centre & Customer Service)
job_desc:
JOB SUMMARY:

Supervises technicians to ensure that customers' needs are met and vehicles are fixed right the first time. Responsible for day-to-day activities of the Service Department including coaching and training Technicians; planning and managing inventory, supplies, and equipment; providing technical information and customer service.

 

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Achieving High Standards
  1. Ensures high quality service and repairs are provided to every customer; maintains a clean, professional environment.
  2. Maintains high ethical standards in daily activities.
  3. Provides technical information and assists Technicians to ensure proper diagnoses of difficult problems.
  4. Implements  processes and standards to ensure customer satisfaction and efficient and effective Service Department operation.
  5. Monitors the flow of work in the Service Department and intervenes as needed to ensure work is accomplished.
  6. Works with Service Advisor to ensure customer satisfaction.
  • Working Effectively With Others
  1. Builds productive working relationships through clear communications.
  2. Has an approachable style; fosters open communication through active listening.
  3. Generates pride and commitment within the Service Department; works with and provides training for the Technicians' development.
  4. Speaks clearly, concisely, and effectively.
  5. Follows up with customers to ensure they are satisfied with service.
  6. Promotes cooperation and teamwork across departmental boundaries.
  • Leading a Winning Team
  1. Builds a winning team by recruiting, hiring, training, coaching, evaluating, motivating, and rewarding Service Department employees.
  2. Evaluates employee performance regularly, providing feedback, training, and career guidance as necessary.
  3. Ensures employees attend training programs to gain required skills and/or certifications.
  4. Delegates work as requested to ensure customer satisfaction while developing employee skills.
  5. Ensures a positive working environment for employees. 
  6. Develops a team atmosphere within the Service Department.
  • Handling Pressure
  1. Solicits, encourages, and implements innovative methods/ideas to improve service and performance.
  2. Resolves internal conflicts among employees in the Service Department.
  3. Prioritizes work to ensure all deadlines are met.
  4. Handles customer complaints that require management's attention.
  5. Maintains quality inspection records.
  • Managing Business Complexity
  1. Analyzes productivity of Technicians.
  2. Reassigns work as necessary.
  3. Establishes processes and standards to ensure customer satisfaction and efficient and effective operations.
  4. Coordinates with Parts Department, Sales Department, Body Shop, General Manager, Ford Representatives, sublet vendors, and others to ensure effectiveness of the service process.
  5. Analyzes problems and establishes procedures to solve them.
  6. Develops marketing and merchandising plans and programs.
  • Understanding and Using Business Knowledge
  1. Flags repair orders according to established procedures.
  2. Provides estimation of time for completion of each repair order.
  3. Maintains systems for tracking time spent on a job.
  4. Provides technical information and assistance to employees as needed.
  5. Utilizes quality control procedures to monitor quality of work.
  6. Implements new Ford and/or dealership systems.
  7. Maintains active professional affiliations and certifications.
  8. Keeps up to date on industry trends.
  9. Maintains Workshop Scheduling board.
  • Applying the Basics
  1. Uses computers to monitor daily operations.
  2. Applies information found in manuals, publications, and other documents.
  3. Utilizes new systems implemented by Ford or the dealership.
  4. Conducts quality checks on service work.

 

JOB QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Candidate must possess at least Bachelor's Degree/Post Graduate Diploma/Professional Degree in Engineering (Mechanical) or Automotive Technology.
  • At least 2 Year(s) of working experience in Service/Workshop Car Dealership.
  • At least 2 years of working experience in a Supervisory position handling Service/Workshop in a Car Dealership.
  • Preferably Junior Executive specialized in Engineering - Mechanical/Automotive or equivalent.
  • Must have an excellent customer service skills.
  • Must have good communication skills.
  • Computer literate and knowledgeable in Microsoft Applications; Word, Ppt and Excel.

title: Mechanical Engineer
job_desc:

  • Oversee preparations of heavy equipment for deployment.

  • Well-organized with strong attention to detail.
  • Working knowledge of MS Office (Excel and Word).

  • Prior work experience in a related field is required.
  • Above average command of English and Tagalog with excellent communication skills.
  • Must have positive attitude towards work, flexible and can easily adapt to any work environment.
  • Team player with a pleasant personality.
  • Must be willing to help out in other job areas if needed.
  • Must be willing to work from Monday-Saturday.

Job Perks:

  • Company-paid lunches.
  • Salary raises and bonuses based on performance.
  • Healthy work environment, no need to overtime.

title: Licensed Mechanical Engineer (Pasig City) - Fresh Graduates
job_desc:
Job Description:

  • Operate & maintain data center support facilities – electrical power distribution, UPS, Generators, HVAC equipment, Chiller Plant, Fire Alarm & Detection System, Fire Suppression, Access Control, Security Surveillance and Wire Management Systems

  • Coordinate with Affiliates & Costumer Facilities Management Team for implementation of contracted preventive maintenance of building facilities.

  • Draw engineering plans, do cost estimates, project schedules & material specifications for facility related projects and customer requirements. 

  • Inspect project construction activities to conform to plans and specifications.

  • Work with technicians on daily operation and maintenance activities.

  • Generate report for O&M for each equipment and keep and update equipment history record.

  • Submit periodic reports, such as, O&M performance reports, project status report.

  • Perform troubleshooting and product support to meet customer service level agreement.

  • Be available on-call 24x7 to respond or assist in the event of emergency and facilities problem affecting project completion and services.

  • Assist Sales group in customer requirement clarifications and inquiries and during site tours.

  • Provide regular reports/updates and do special tasks/projects as assigned by the Facilities Head.

Job Requirements:

  • Graduate of Mechanical Engineering

  • Preferably Registered Mechanical Engineer.

  • Has knowledge on 24×7 Operations and Maintenance of electrical system, air conditioning system, electromatic auxiliary system or structured cabling

  • Can perform problem analysis and initial recommendation on physical cabling system and building facilities.

  • Fresh Graduates are welcome to apply

  • Open to work on a shifting schedule

  • Can start ASAP.

  • Willing to be assigned in VITRO Pasig City
